author: RAY Network
title: RAY Swap
description: Cardano ecosystem needs more competitive AMM exchange tools.

assessments.note: I give a 1 for impact because the proposal provides very little information for how they will solve the problem of cardano users needing access to a UniSwap like app. It may be true that Cardano users do need this type of application but if the only concept is to copy UniSwap then I don't see why so much money is needed to copy something else.

This proposal addresses the challenge of scaling up Cardano's DeFi by bringing in essentially a fork of uniswap, adapting the contracts over to Plutus. The proposal doesn't include a plan on how it will attract liquidity providers to Ray Swap or why LPs would want to use their platform over others in the same space.
This is a DeFi project, not scaling up other DeFi projects which is the goal.
assessments.reply: This is completele Scale-Up DeFi project.

assessments.note:
The problem statement does not present a problem but a solution, I recommend changing the statement to facilitate the understanding of the proposal.

The proposal proposes the creation of a DEX in the AMM model, which is within the scope of the challenge. The defined goals indicate delivery of the mainnet public release within the period of 6 months, therefore within the expected for the challenge.
The team behind this is experienced in webapp development and learning Plutus in the pioneer program, highly likely to successfully implement this app on schedule.

I give a 1 for feasibility of impact because the only budgetary information given is the hourly rate to pay coders. I would like to see information about what coders will do with those hours of work. I don't understand, based on submission, what kind of work needs to be done.

Given that the team has good experience in web dev, that side of things is covered however there is a large risk in being able to adapt contracts from Ethereum to a fundamentally different transaction model. the team is part of the plutus pioneers program however there is risk that they will face trouble. There are also no specific dates in the plan, or recognition of milestones in progress that the project is dependent on.

Not a very detailed plan provided. This proposal is to provide functionality to a project the proposer is building (and has 2 other proposal in to cover functionality for). How feasible is is to reverse engineer uniswap, please provide evidence.

The team has experience in software development, web development and is participating in the Plutus Pionner Program. I recommend including more details about the other members of the team, as there are only details about Nick's bio.

The budget was set in relation to hours of work to carry out the project.
 
This part of the proposal is confusing: "Our goal is to make a token exchange section in the RAY Wallet". Will DEX users have to use the RAY wallet to interact with DEX? Will it be possible to interact through Yoroi? My point is that reliance on an external wallet can introduce security problems and dependency on RAY wallet.


The team did reverse engineering on the Uniswap protocol and this allowed for better performance, but what does better performance mean? There is no clear definition of the changes in relation to the Uniswap protocol. Is there any change in the equations? Is there a bonding curve model?

What is the team's expertise in the development of alternative financial models for the exchange?

Many DEXs are taking advantage of the work developed by Uniswap to make a "vampire attack", forking the code, but this creates dependency on the work developed by the Uniswap team and on the financial models and equations. Uniswap develops regular updates and this week implemented changes to the protocol (v3). What is the team's capacity to develop new implementations and keep the protocol updated?

Can you talk about the security of funds in your wallet and on the exchange? There's lots of action in your Github depository, so it's great to see that your getting stuff done. Tell us more about the NFT market place and Ray Kickstart.
I give a 1 for auditability because the only clear metric that we could evaluate on is trading volume. Trading volume with no other metrics lacks meaning.

The proposal includes a budget and some details on what success looks like however it doesn't provide a timing plan prior to launch, it would be very difficult to assess the progress of the project prior to launch according to this plan.

Proposal is to provide functionality to a product, in that sense easy to audit. No KPI's given on which to measure success. Please provide KPI's which align with the challenge goal which can be used to measure success.

There is no definition of the problem to be solved (it is implied that the problem is the lack of DEXs at Cardano, but this needs to be better communicated so that it is not subject to interpretation)

There is information that indicates how the proposal will address the challenge and promote improvements for Cardano, the development of a DEX is an essential application for the DeFi ecosystem.

There is a budget breakdown, the timeline is defined in 4 months and is within the scope of the challenge.

Relevant metrics have been defined, but KPIs have not been defined.

solution: Adaptation of the Uniswap smart contracts (which is distributed under the GNU license) for the Plutus platform.
experience: We are a software development company (web development) with extensive experience in developing javascript applications.
